title: High Air Pollution Levels
description: In 2020, Niger recorded a mean annual PM2.5 air pollution exposure of 85.12 micrograms per cubic meter, one of the highest globally.

title: Widespread Informal Competition
description: In 2017, 85.1% of firms in Niger reported facing competition from unregistered firms, indicating a significant informal sector presence.

title: Strong Agricultural Sector
description: As of 2023, agriculture, forestry, and fishing contribute 47.81% to Niger's GDP, highlighting the sector's importance to the economy.

title: Severe Learning Poverty Among Girls
description: In 2019, 100% of female children at the end-of-primary age were below minimum reading proficiency, adjusted for out-of-school children.

title: High Female Out-of-School Rates
description: In 2019, 100% of female primary school age children were out of school, indicating a critical education gap.

title: High Adolescent Out-of-School Rates
description: In 2023, 72.97% of female and 71.63% of male adolescents of lower secondary school age were out of school.

title: High Child Mortality Rates
description: In 2023, Niger's under-5 mortality rate was 114.8 per 1,000 live births, with 110.7 for females and 118.5 for males.

title: Effective Use of Bed Nets
description: In 2015, 95.5% of the under-5 population used insecticide-treated bed nets, indicating strong malaria prevention efforts.

title: High Health Expenditure-Induced Poverty
description: In 2018, 78.53% of the population was pushed or further pushed below the $3.65 poverty line due to out-of-pocket health expenditures.

title: High Youth Employment Rates
description: In 2022, 78.35% of males aged 15-24 were employed, reflecting a strong youth employment rate.

title: Young Female Population
description: In 2023, 46.91% of Niger's female population was aged 0-14, indicating a young demographic profile.

title: Low Coverage of Social Insurance Programs
description: In 2021, only 21.4% of the population in the third quintile was covered by social insurance programs, indicating limited social safety nets.

title: Low Educational Attainment in Lower Secondary
description: As of 2022, only 11.5% of males aged 25 and above had completed lower secondary education, highlighting educational challenges.

title: Minimal Post-Secondary Education Completion
description: In 2022, merely 1.38% of the population aged 25 and above had completed post-secondary education, reflecting low higher education attainment.

title: Limited Progression to Secondary School for Females
description: In 2015, only 56% of females progressed to secondary school, indicating gender disparities in education.

title: Low Prevalence of Overweight in Children
description: In 2022, only 0.5% of female children under five were overweight, suggesting low levels of childhood obesity.

title: Low Youth Unemployment Rate
description: In 2024, the youth unemployment rate was estimated at 16.3%, reflecting a relatively low level of youth joblessness.

title: Low Female Unemployment Rate
description: The female unemployment rate was estimated at 25.8% in 2024, indicating a relatively low level of female joblessness.

title: Low Employment in Industry for Males
description: In 2023, only 5.4% of male employment was in the industry sector, showing limited industrial employment opportunities.
